Detailed Description

Simulate robot motion and sensor.

Author:
Erion Plaku
Remarks:
Simulator provides functionality to simulate the robot motion and the sensor. Simulator is considered as an input to your implementation of the bug algorithms. As such, you should not make changes to Simulator. In particular, your bug algorithms should only access the public functions of Simulator. If, however, you see that the functionality provided by the Simulator class is not sufficient to implement your bug algorithms, please contact the support staff for this project (see main webpage for contact information). In your email, succinctly describe the functionality you intend to add to this class and the reasons as to why it is necessary for your implementation of the bug algorithms.

Member Function Documentation

double Simulator::TakeSensorReading ( double &  xmin,
double &  ymin 
) const

Compute the minimum distance from the center of the robot to the obstacles (if within sensing range).

Parameters:
xmin 
ymin 
Remarks:
  • Returns the minimum distance from the center of the robot to the obstacles
  • upon return, xmin and ymin contain the x-coord and y-coord of the obstacle point that achieves this miminum
  • if the obstacles are outside the sensing range, then GetSensorRadius() is returned and xmin and ymin are set to HUGE_VAL

double Simulator::GetRobotMaxStepLength ( void   )  const [inline]

Maximum step length that the robot can take.

Remarks:
Use this value when determining the dx and dy robot displacements. You need to ensure that the robot is taking small steps, i.e., displacement (sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy)) should not be larger than the max step length
